intro: Euphorbia gatbergensis, commonly known as the Greenland euphorbia, is a succulent plant native to the Arctic regions of Greenland. It is characterized by its fleshy, spiny stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or green. The plant has adapted to harsh, cold environments by developing a thick cuticle to reduce water loss and store moisture. It is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils, where it can survive extreme temperature fluctuations. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists studying Arctic flora.
